Product Title: Amazon Basics Computer Speakers for Desktop or Laptop PC | USB-Powered
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2019
Review Title: Decent Speakers, but super bright led light is distracting
Review Description: I was looking for some simple, cheap speakers for my desktop computer.  These fit that except for one thing not shown in the pictures.  There's a blue LED light on it that's more than just a little distracting.  Had I known about it, I'd have passed on the purchase.  Now that I've got them, I'm going to stick a piece of gorilla tape over that LED because it's a distraction.  I really dont know why that little blue LED has to be so bright, but otherwise I'd have given these 5 stars.

Product Title: Amazon Basics Computer Speakers for Desktop or Laptop PC | USB-Powered
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2019
Review Description: There is a high pitched buzz when turning on the power and increasing the volume past 10%.  Turning up my computer volume all the way makes it load enough for an office environment, while maintaining the volume on the speaker low enough not to get the feedback.  The 3.55mm passthrough is not very good.  I have moderate priced ear buds and the quality directly from the computer is excellent.  When I plug them into the speak, the quality is crap and has to remain low volume otherwise I pick up the buzzing feedback.  Oh, and the bright blue blinding light,  who the hell let that pass through quality check.  Used one day, then threw in my desk drawer, lesson learned.

Product Title: Amazon Basics Computer Speakers for Desktop or Laptop PC | USB-Powered
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2020
Review Description: One word: A-freakin'-mazing. Before I bought these, I was suffering from Builtinspeakeritis. I couldn't tell left from right, high from low. It affected every aspect of my life. Music seemed dull and lifeless. I watched an episode of Tiger King and found it pedestrian. My life was so incomplete that, when I went out, people looked at me like I was a nobody... if they looked at me at all.This set of speakers changed everything. Sure, the sound is tinny, and they don't get much louder than a mouse fart. But now when I'm watching COPS, I can tell whether the perp is being chased from off-screen left or off-screen right. I find myself thumping along in the tub to Chumbawamba. And Zoom meetings for work? Well, let's just say that these days I hear the voice of Renee from Accounting in my dreams.Owning these speakers has totally changed how people respond to me, too. Ladies smile at me at the grocery store now. I mean, I can't actually see them smiling, since they're wearing masks to avoid COVID-19, but I can just tell that this time the checkout girl isn't going to report me to the manager.Before buying these, I had tried everything: $100/hour online counseling with a surprisingly attractive Eastern European therapist; blue pills from a registered pharmacy in Uruguay; even subzero naked yoga (don't ask). It turns out, I could have spared my wallet (and my genitals) the pain. All I needed was this inexpensive pair of speakers—with its blindingly bright blue LED and its complete absence of bass—to get me back in the game. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have to find out more about that hottie Carole Baskin on Tiger King.

Product Title: Amazon Basics Computer Speakers for Desktop or Laptop PC | USB-Powered
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2019
Review Description: These speakers are really great. Sound quality is really good, especially for the price. I was looking for small speakers that I could attached to my PC at work and that had an earphone jack in the front. The only really small downside is the front light is really bright. Kind of annoying so I just covered it with tape. Problem solved. I would definitely recommend.

Product Title: Amazon Basics Computer Speakers for Desktop or Laptop PC | USB-Powered
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2019
Review Description: I wanted an external speaker that would be louder than my laptop provides. I run a sewing machine while watching tv on the laptop. These will not work, it's barely above a whisper even at max loudness. I'll be sending them back and buying from a brick and mortar where I can plug them in to see how they work first. They seem like good quality; no directions came with them. They are plug and play but I didn't have the headphone jack in far enough so they seemed to not work at first.

Product Title: Amazon Basics Computer Speakers for Desktop or Laptop PC | USB-Powered
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2019
Review Title: Good but ANNOYING blue ON light.
Review Description: Setup is easy. Speakers are small but put out good sound.Both speakers are attached by a thick wire; not the thin cheap kind. The main speaker has another cord of the same that splits: one into your audio jack(green) and a USB for power. No need for drivers.Reason: A cheap pair I got in 2011 at a flea market for $10 finally died. Considering how long those lasted I can't complain. You're not going to get super loud sound or high base/treble. In my opinion, an average cheaper option.Packaging: Amazon Basic packaging. Three small plastic bags around each speaker and wire bundle. Item arrived in perfect condition.CON: For some reason, more tech developers are putting in these BRIGHT, annoying blue lights to indicate power. I'll get some electrical tape to cover it up. It is that bright and annoying.

Product Title: Amazon Basics Computer Speakers for Desktop or Laptop PC | USB-Powered
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2019
Review Title: Way better quality than any other cheap speaker
Review Description: Fantastic!For the price I was ecstatic about the quality.Was looking for some cheap speakers for my In room projector,and these were perfect.Sometimes mistake the sound from the speakers as real time noises because it’s so clear.Absolutely love it!

Product Title: Amazon Basics Computer Speakers for Desktop or Laptop PC | USB-Powered
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2019
Review Title: Painfully bright LED, lightweight and tippy
Review Description: Decent sound quality for the size and it's nice not to have a wall wart. Also nice basic look in matte black. Downsides: (1) The blue LED is painfully bright. I'll put black tape over it. (2) Light weight and stiff cables means that it's hard to get the speakers to stand upright on a desk. The cables tend to pull them over. These speakers are smaller than they appear. Read the dimensions.

Product Title: Amazon Basics Computer Speakers for Desktop or Laptop PC | USB-Powered
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2019
Review Description: These speakers looked wonderful, but the left speaker had "noise" and static right out of the box.  It was very dissappointing to have to deal with return and the hassle.  Update:  the new pair work great, but having a product return code meant taking the defective ones to a store instead of being picked up by UPS delivery person.  The store was 40 miles away!  Luckily, I had to to to the city anyway;  otherwise it would have been a BIG problem.  Better to just be able to print a label and have UPS pick them up!

Product Title: Amazon Basics Computer Speakers for Desktop or Laptop PC | USB-Powered
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2019
Review Description: Pros:1: It installs easily.Con:1:The blue light, the struggle is real. Even with duct tape over it, it's blinding.2: Volume is garbage. At max volume it's about the same as my iMac built in speakers.3: If you leave them on with no output, it starts making a high pitched sound that grows in volume until you turn them off. IE, every time I stop using my computer, I have to turn the speakers off to avoid losing my sanity.WORST PRODUCT I'VE EVER BOUGHT. It's not even worth the return label.

Product Title: Amazon Basics Computer Speakers for Desktop or Laptop PC | USB-Powered
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2019
Review Title: Comes with free eye destroying laser beam
Review Description: A good value for the money. I could certainly do without the eye destroying blue laser light shining out of the front. Who could possibly want a light that bright showing power status? If there is sound coming from speakers they are on. It is daytime and my eye still can't adjust to the brightness of this blue light. Please consider buying blue blocker sunglasses with these speakers. Seriously WTF?!UPDATE: RETURNED DUE TO OBNOXIOUS NOISE WHEN HEADPHONES PLUGGGED IN.

Product Title: Amazon Basics Computer Speakers for Desktop or Laptop PC | USB-Powered
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2019
Review Description: Horrible speakers! You can barely hear them!!!! I was shocked that they were so low. A total waste of money. May I send them back, PLEASE???! Ugh!

Product Title: Amazon Basics Computer Speakers for Desktop or Laptop PC | USB-Powered
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2019
Review Title: Constant hissing and pops, LED is too bright. Returned.
Review Description: These speakers sounded very good for their size and the price, and I liked that they could be powered by USB, but they emit pops and hissing spikes when no sound or music is coming from the computer, which was an annoying deal breaker. My old $10 Logitechs never did that. Also, the blue power LED is WAAAAAY too bright. I had to put some tape over it. I returned the speakers for a refund.

Product Title: Amazon Basics Computer Speakers for Desktop or Laptop PC | USB-Powered
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2019
Review Description: The speakers work. The sound quality isn't amazing, but you don't expect amazing from something so cheap. For the price, the sound is fine. The speakers are function, but, straight from the packaging, produce a fair amount of static, which is very distracting and can make it hard to understand whatever I'm trying to listen to. Even when the computer isn't playing audio, the speakers make the static sounds. I can sit a few feet away from the idle speakers and hear the crackling. Occasionally, but not often, the speakers will distort audio beyond recognition. Unplugging and replugging them in a few times normally solves the problem, but it's a big annoyance.  From glancing at other reviews, I've gleaned not I'm not the only one with these problems, even if they aren't very common. If you're willing to take a bit of a chance on an inexpensive product, these may work fine for you. When they work, they work fine. The quality is acceptable, the volume control is easy and convenient, and the speakers are easy to plug in with their fairly long cords.

Product Title: Amazon Basics Computer Speakers for Desktop or Laptop PC | USB-Powered
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2020
Review Title: Do NOT buy these. They are outright dangerous. Caused an electrical short!!!!
Review Description: I was pretty happy with these up until one of them shorted out and started turning my entire computer case into an electrical hazard.  I ended up with a pretty nasty shock my simply touching the back of my computer case to install a new keyboard. After spending a couple hundred dollars on an electrician to ensure that there wasn't something wrong in our electrical system and we did test after test, come to find out, the internal wiring on these made in china white labeled trash isn't even soldered properly. Your shitty speakers cost me hundreds of dollars.DO NOT BUY THESE. Amazon needs to start learning that if they're going to put their name on random products, they should learn a thing or two about them first. Like, ya know, IF THEY'RE ACTUALLY BUILT SAFELY.

Product Title: Amazon Basics Computer Speakers for Desktop or Laptop PC | USB-Powered
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2020
Review Title: May need to play with computer sound settings
Review Description: Well, at first I thought these were terrible.  I plugged them in and when it came time to test on a video call; hardly any sound was coming out.  It was quieter than my computer so, I used the computer (which wasn't really loud enough to begin with and the reason I bought the speakers).  Then, I poked around the sound settings on my computer and found the default device was set to a monitor that doesn't have audio and therefore a master volume setting was turned down too low. So, I set it to 100 and BAM! Sound!  They're working great now. Sound is clear and volume is finally loud enough.

Product Title: Amazon Basics Computer Speakers for Desktop or Laptop PC | USB-Powered
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2020
Review Description: Overall, these aren't the worst speakers in the world, but I don't even think they are worth the $15. There is no bass at all and they are nearly on par with low grade laptop speakers. They almost "rattle" like a tin can. On top of that, there is very little shielding on the wires/plugs used on these speakers, as they pick up a ton of noise - like when I move my mouse around. Finally, the speakers are just generally unpleasant due to the fact that they make an audible hissing noise if you turn the knob past a quarter-way.

Product Title: Amazon Basics Computer Speakers for Desktop or Laptop PC | USB-Powered
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2019
Review Description: This is for the AC powered stereo speakers. And I was attempting to use them with windows 10. The sound was not good because there was a significant buzzing in the audio. I returned these and ordered different  speakers from Amazon that were USB powered. I don’t know if what I got was just defective, or what.

Product Title: Amazon Basics Computer Speakers for Desktop or Laptop PC | USB-Powered
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2021
Review Description: These speakers are pretty much bottom-of-the-barrel without actually scraping the boards, but they work.Pros:- Price. Ranges from $10.49 to $19.78. I paid $17.99. Even at the highest price, these speakers are cheap.- Ease of setup. There's the audio cable and a USB power cord. That's it. If you need to plug them into an A/C outlet, you'll need a USB-A to AC adapter, which pretty much every electronic thing ever comes with (except these speakers).- Size. They're small and work great either vertically or set on their size horizontally.- Portability. They're super tiny and only have two plugs, so they're easily carried with a laptop or something else.- Audio jack. You can plug in wired headphones directly to the speakers.Cons:- Sound quality. It's not great, but it gets the job done if you're just watching YouTube or something similar. I wouldn't use these if you listen to music through your speakers on a regular basis.- The LED power light is so bright it hurts my eyes. I put a piece of electrical tape over it to cover it.- Build quality. I almost put my thumb through the mesh over the cones a few times while I was setting them up. It's extremely thin and if you grab them too hard, it'll definitely puncture.- There's no USB-A to AC adapter in the box, so you either have to plug them into a USB port for power, or use your own adapter.

Product Title: Amazon Basics Computer Speakers for Desktop or Laptop PC | USB-Powered
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2020
Review Title: Sound works, but not my favorite speakers
Review Description: I have mixed feelings about these speakers. I got them to use for my work computer. They've served the sound purpose just fine so far though I've only had them a few months. However, 1 thing I would like to see changed on these speakers is the "On" light.  It is a VERY intense, bright blue light.  I love having a light on the speakers to signify that they are on, but the high intensity blue light is hard on the eyes if you don't position the speakers away from you.The second thing is something very odd I've never had with speakers before. I switch back and forth between using a microphone headset for zoom meetings and when not zooming, have the speakers on so I can hear work IM's coming in if I'm working in another program.Sometimes, if you turn the knob to "off" the speakers turn themselves on again.  The first time this happened, I thought it was just me that had forgotten. But nope, this has happened multiple times, even if I turn the knob left until it CLICKS into the office position, it is not uncommon to come back later and find it not clicked off.  I know. It sounds crazy. Yet when they do that, you still have to click them off then on again to get them truly working.So while the sound has been fine for my needs, I'm not sure I would buy these same speakers again.
